intro: Soldanella alpina f. subalpina, commonly known as the subalpine sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it is adapted to cold and harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, helping it retain moisture in arid mountain environments. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in alpine ecosystems.
